topic.title: Contextual Menu Actions in the JSON Schema Design Mode

keywords.indexterm: JSON Schema diagram editorContextual menu actions
JSON Schema Design modeContextual menu actions

body.p: The contextual menu of the Design mode includes the following actions:

dlentry.dd: Navigates to the referenced schema component. This action is also available by clicking the arrow displayed in its bottom right corner.
Allows you to edit the properties of the selected component in a in-place editor.

dd.p: Allows you to edit the annotation for the selected schema component in the Edit Annotations dialog box.

dlentry.dd: Offers a list of valid components, depending on the context, and appends your selection as a child of the currently selected component. You can set a name for a named component after it has been added in the diagram.

Offers a list of valid components, depending on the context, and inserts your selection before the selected component, as a sibling. You can set a name for a named component after it has been added in the diagram.

Offers a list of valid components, depending on the context, and inserts your selection after the selected component, as a sibling. You can set a name for a named component after it has been added in the diagram.
Cuts the selected component(s).
Copies the selected component(s) to the clipboard.
Pastes the component(s) from the clipboard as children of the selected component.
Removes the selected component(s).

Marks the selected property as being required in the parent object. By default, the defined properties are not required in the JSON schema. You can set a list of required properties in the required keyword. By invoking the action, the name of the property is added in the parent object's required keyword.

Marks the selected property as being optional in the parent object. By default, the defined properties are optional in the JSON schema. You can set a list of required properties in the required keyword. By invoking the action, the name of the property is deleted from the parent object's required keyword.

Allows you to extract a definition as a global definition and reference it. It can be used on a property to extract its definition (in case you want to reuse it) or on a local definition to extract it as global one. Note that this action is not available for global definitions.
Converts the selected property's type into an any type with the value true or false. You can set true value to represent a schema that matches anything, or false for a schema that matches nothing.

Converts the selected definition's type into an any type definition with the value true or false. Setting the value to true represents a schema that matches anything, while false is for a schema that matches nothing.

Converts the selected conditional's type into an any type with the value true or false. Setting the value to true represents a schema that matches anything, while false is for a schema that matches nothing.
Converts the selected property's any type into a standard type property.
Converts the selected definition's any type into a standard type property.
Converts the selected conditional's any type into a standard type conditional.
Moves a component up in its parent
Moves a component down in its parent
Recursively expands all sub-components of the selected component.
Recursively collapses all sub-components of the selected component.
Prints the selected component diagram.
Saves the selected component diagram as image, in JPEG, BMP, SVG or PNG format.
Opens the JSON Schema preferences page where you can control which properties to display for JSON Schema components in the JSON Schema Design mode.
